verses.text: Keep silence before me, O islands; And let the people renew \add their\add* strength: Let them come near; then let them speak: Let us come near together to judgment.

Who raised up the righteous \add man\add* from the east, Called him to his foot, Gave the nations before him, and made \add him\add* rule over kings? He gave \add them\add* as the dust \add to\add* his sword, \add And\add* as driven stubble \add to\add* his bow.
He pursued them, \add and\add* passed safely; \add Even by\add* the way \add that\add* he had not gone with his feet.
Who hath wrought and done \add it\add*, Calling the generations from the beginning? I the \sc Lord\sc*, the first, And with the last; I \add am\add* he.
The isles saw \add it\add*, and feared; The ends of the earth were afraid, Drew near, and came.
They helped every one his neighbour; And \add every one\add* said to his brother, Be of good courage.

So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith, \add And\add* he that smootheth \add with\add* the hammer him that smote the anvil, Saying, It \add is\add* ready for the sodering: And he fastened it with nails, \add that\add* it should not be moved.
But thou, Israel, \add art\add* my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, The seed of Abraham my friend.
\add Thou\add* whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, And called thee from the chief men thereof, And said unto thee, Thou \add art\add* my servant; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.

Fear thou not; for I \add am\add* with thee: Be not dismayed; for I \add am\add* thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; Yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
Behold, all they that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded: They shall be as nothing; and they that strive with thee shall perish.
Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, \add even\add* them that contended with thee: They that war against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of nought.
For I the \sc Lord\sc* thy God will hold thy right hand, Saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
Fear not, thou worm Jacob, \add and\add* ye men of Israel; I will help thee, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, And thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: Thou shalt thresh the mountains, and beat \add them\add* small, And shalt make the hills as chaff.
Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away, And the whirlwind shall scatter them: And thou shalt rejoice in the \sc Lord\sc*, \add And\add* shalt glory in the Holy One of Israel.

\add When\add* the poor and needy seek water, and \add there is\add* none, \add And\add* their tongue faileth for thirst, I the \sc Lord\sc* will hear them, \add I\add* the God of Israel will not forsake them.
I will open rivers in high places, And fountains in the midst of the valleys: I will make the wilderness a pool of water, And the dry land springs of water.
I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the shittah tree, and the myrtle, and the oil tree; I will set in the desert the fir tree, \add and\add* the pine, and the box tree together:
That they may see, and know, and consider, and understand together, That the hand of the \sc Lord\sc* hath done this, And the Holy One of Israel hath created it.
Produce your cause, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Bring forth your strong \add reasons\add*, saith the King of Jacob.

Let them bring \add them\add* forth, and shew us what shall happen: Let them shew the former \add things\add*, what they \add be\add*, That we may consider \add them\add*, and know the latter end of them; Or declare us \add things\add* for to come.
Shew the \add things\add* that are to come hereafter, That we may know that ye \add are\add* gods: Yea, do good, or do evil, That we may be dismayed, and behold \add it\add* together.
Behold, ye \add are\add* of nothing, and your work of nought: An abomination \add is he that\add* chooseth you.

I have raised up \add one\add* from the north, and he shall come: From the rising of the sun shall he call upon my name: And he shall come \add upon\add* princes as \add upon\add* morter, And as the potter treadeth clay.

Who hath declared from the beginning, that we may know? And beforetime, that we may say, \add He is\add* righteous? Yea, \add there is\add* none that sheweth, yea, \add there is\add* none that declareth, Yea, \add there is\add* none that heareth your words.
The first \add shall say\add* to Zion, Behold, behold them: And I will give to Jerusalem one that bringeth good tidings.
For I beheld, and \add there was\add* no man; Even amongst them, and \add there was\add* no counseller, That, when I asked of them, could answer a word.
Behold, they \add are\add* all vanity; their works \add are\add* nothing: Their molten images \add are\add* wind and confusion.
